HTMLENCODE() Syntax Encoded_String as C = HTMLENCODE( Input_String as C [, Strict_Flag as L] ) Encoded_String as C = HTMLENCODE( Input_String as D [, Strict_Flag as L] ) Encoded_String as C = HTMLENCODE( Input_String as N [, Strict_Flag as L] ) ArgumentDescription Input_StringThe string to be encoded and it can be a character, numeric or data input. Strict_FlagOptional. Default = .F. (FALSE). Strict_Flag controls strict encoding.
.F. = Only the most common characters are substituted with their HTML entity value.
.T. = All characters which have HTML character entities will be converted.
Description HTMLENCODE() transforms a string in order to make it HTML-safe. Certain characters are have special meanings within HTML documents and should not be used directly. This function always returns a character string - numeric or date inputs will automatically be converted to character.
& becomes &
" becomes
' becomes
> becomes > This is sufficient for most all web applications and allows you to easily store HTML and other reserved characters in your database and convert them on-the-fly for display within a web page. Example htmlencode("") -> <HTML TAG> htmlencode("",.T.) -> <HTML TAG>
See Also Internet Functions and Methods, Encryption Function and Methods
